body_html:
TF 1.11 not TF 1.10 did change cuDNN versions from 7.0 to 7.2 but I suspect many people were already on 7.2. This change is/will be in the release notes and was due to a TensorRT 4.x requirement.

Additionally, we will move to CUDA 10.x as fast as possible once it is GA, and NVIDIA plans to have a bigger range of device driver support that should allow us to move versions faster without causing people problems. It is a bit of a no win situation and learn as you go kind of thing.

TF 1.11 not TF 1.10 did change cuDNN versions from 7.0 to 7.2 but I suspect many people were already on 7.2.  This change is/will be in the release notes and was due to a TensorRT 4.x requirement.
Additionally, we will move to CUDA 10.x as fast as possible once it is GA, and NVIDIA plans to have a bigger range of device driver support that should allow us to move versions faster without causing people problems.  It is a bit of a no win situation and learn as you go kind of thing.
body:
TF 1.11 not TF 1.10 did change cuDNN versions from 7.0 to 7.2 but I suspect many people were already on 7.2.  This change is/will be in the release notes and was due to a TensorRT 4.x requirement.  

Additionally, we will move to CUDA 10.x as fast as possible once it is GA, and NVIDIA plans to have a bigger range of device driver support that should allow us to move versions faster without causing people problems.  It is a bit of a no win situation and learn as you go kind of thing.
